description.en: The course develops students' skills of writing policy-papers and planning advocacy campaigns. Students will be introduced to the main genres of policy-writing and the basic strategies and techniques for influencing decision-making. A core component of the course is a hands-on practical project for which students will identify a policy issue, analyze alternative policy options, and produce a position paper that outlines a convincing argument to support a preferred course of action. In the end of the project, students will plan their advocacy strategy for putting their position paper into action.
description.et: Kursuse käigus õpitakse kirjutama poliitikapabereid ja planeerima ning hindama huvikaitset. Kursuse keskseks komponendiks on praktiline projekt, mille raames viivad tudengid läbi lihtsa poliitikanalüüsi nende poolt valitud avaliku poliitika probleemi lahendamiseks ning koostavad vastaval teemal positsioonipaberi koos omapoolsete soovitustega. Projekti lõpus esitavad tudengid oma projektile sobiva huvikaitsestrateegia ning plaani selle mõjude hindamiseks.

objectives.en: This course introduces students to policy-writing and advocacy. The aim of the course is to develop students' skills and knowledge for influencing public policy-making processes through carrying out policy analyses, writing policy briefs and position papers, and planning advocacy campaigns.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on arendada tudengite teadmisi ja oskusi avaliku poliitika kujundamise protsesside mõjutamiseks. Kursuses keskendutakse poliitikaanalüüsi läbiviimisele, poliitikaülevaadete ja positsioonipaberite kirjutamisele ning huvikaitse planeerimisele ja hindamisele.

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the course, students will:
* master the basic skills of policy analysis and writing for the policy process;
learning_outcomes.et: * on omandanud peamised poliitikaanalüüsi läbiviimise oskused;

learning_outcomes.en: * be able to produce effective policy briefs and position papers;
learning_outcomes.et: * oskab kirjutada efektiivseid poliitikaülevaateid ja positsioonipabereid;

learning_outcomes.en: * be able to design a successful advocacy strategy and evaluate its impacts.
learning_outcomes.et: * oskab planeerida huvikaitse tegevusi ja hinnata nende mõju.

independent_work.en: Policy Issue Memo (15%, graded) - Frame your policy issue and select an organization that you will represent in the policy-writing assignment. Define the policy issue, describe the scope of the problem and its effects, and present a convincing rationale for action. You will receive a separate handout on this assignment. Policy Paper Analysis (15%, graded) - Join a team and complete an analysis of a sample policy brief. Choose one of the published policy briefs provided by the instructor and analyze its structural and textual elements. You will receive a separate handout on this assignment. Policy Options Matrix Exercise (10%, pass/fail) - Submit the policy options matrix that you have prepared for your policy analysis and evaluate another student's work via Moodle. You will receive a separate handout with instructions. Logic Model Exercise (10%, pass/fail) - Complete an exercise on designing a logic model for advocacy impact assessment. You will receive a separate handout with instructions. Position Paper (25%, graded) - Describe your chosen policy issue and present a convincing argument to support a preferred course of action. Draw on your analysis of alternative policy options and compare the expected outcomes. You will receive a separate handout on this assignment. Advocacy Evaluation Plan (25%, graded) - Develop an advocacy evaluation plan for your project by outlining a logic model along with the measures and methods for impact assessment. You will receive a separate handout on this assignment.
